required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fludarabine and Rituximab for the Treatment of Marginal Zone Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of Fludarabine and Rituximab for the Treatment of Marginal Zone Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effectiveness of six cycles of concurrent fludarabine and rituximab in patients with mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT) lymphoma, marginal zone lymphoma (MZL) or CD5-, CD10-, CD20+ low-grade B cell lymphomas.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objectives:
Primary
- To estimate the objective response rate.
Secondary
- To assess the safety.
- To describe the progression-free survival at one year.
- To examine the association between clonal cytogenetic abnormalities identified by FISH, and the objective response rate as well as the progression-free survival at one year.
Target enrollment was 30 eligible patients. An 80% objective response rate at 1 month restaging after 6 cycles was considered as evidence of activity in this patient population while 60% was not considered activity. If at least 22 patients achieved objective response the treatment would be considered promising. With 30 eligible patients, the probability of observing this was 0.87 assuming a true rate of 80% and 0.09 assuming a true rate of 60%.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed after three- and six-cycles of therapy.
primary_outcome.description: Objective response rate is defined as the proportion of patients who achieve complete remission (CR), complete remission/unconfirmed (CRu) or partial remission (PR) based on Cheson criteria (1999).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed after 3- and 6-cycles of therapy, every 6 months for 2 years and then annually up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: 3.1-year progression-free survival is the probability of patients remaining alive and progression-free at 3.1 years from study entry estimated using Kaplan-Meier methods. Disease progression was assessed per Cheson criteria (1999).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed after 3- and 6-cycles of therapy, every 6 months for 2 years and then annually up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: 3.1-year overall survival is the probability of patients remaining alive 3.1 years from study entry.

arm_group.description: Fludarabine: 25 mg/m2 on days 1-5 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab: 375 mg/m2 on day 1 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab dose was split between days 1 and 3 for patients with absolute lymphocyte counts > 10x10^9/L Patients received three cycles of therapy followed by re-staging with chest/ abdomen/ pelvic CT scan. Patients with progressive disease discontinued treatment. Patients with stable or responding disease continued therapy for another 3 cycles.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed, newly diagnosed or relapsed MALT, marginal zone lymphoma, or low-grade B cell lymphoproliferative disorder which is CD5-, CD10- and CD20+
- Pathology must be reviewed at Brigham & Women's Hospital, Massachusetts General Hospital, or the University of Rochester James P. Wilmot Cancer Center prior to enrollment
- Documentation of CD20+ status
- Must not be a candidate for local radiotherapy with curative intent
- If gastric MALT, not a candidate for antibiotic therapy with curative intent
- Patients with leukemic phase marginal zone lymphoma are eligible if their absolute lymphocyte count is >10,000 / Âµl
- Prior treatment with rituximab is permitted, if rituximab induced an objective response which persisted for at least 6 months
- Prior radiotherapy is acceptable
- Measurable disease
- ANC: > 1000/mm3
- Platelets: > 100,000/mm3
- Hemoglobin: > 7 gm/dL
- Adequate renal function as indicated by serum creatinine <= 2 mg/dL.
- Adequate liver function, as indicated by serum total bilirubin <= 2 mg/dL.
- AST or ALT <3x Upper Limit of Normal unless related to primary disease.
- Men and women of reproductive potential must agree to use an acceptable method of birth control during study treatment and for six months after completion of study treatment.
- WHO Performance status </= 2
- Subject has provided written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Waldenstrom's Macroglobulinemia or lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma are excluded
- History of HIV
- Active infection
- Known CNS disease
- Pregnant (a negative serum pregnancy test should be performed for all women of childbearing potential within 7 days of treatment) or currently lactating women
- Prior treatment within the last three weeks
- Prior fludarabine
- Positive direct antiglobulin test

results_reference.citation: Brown JR, Friedberg JW, Feng Y, Scofield S, Phillips K, Dal Cin P, Joyce R, Takvorian RW, Fisher DC, Fisher RI, Liesveld J, Marquis D, Neuberg D, Freedman AS. A phase 2 study of concurrent fludarabine and rituximab for the treatment of marginal zone lymphomas. Br J Haematol. 2009 Jun;145(6):741-8. doi: 10.1111/j.1365-2141.2009.07677.x. Epub 2009 Mar 30.

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate
outcome.description: Objective response rate is defined as the proportion of patients who achieve complete remission (CR), complete remission/unconfirmed (CRu) or partial remission (PR) based on Cheson criteria (1999).
outcome.time_frame: Assessed after three- and six-cycles of therapy.
outcome.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

group.title: Fludarabine and Rituximab
group.description: Fludarabine: 25 mg/m2 on days 1-5 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab: 375 mg/m2 on day 1 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab dose was split between days 1 and 3 for patients with absolute lymphocyte counts > 10x10^9/L Patients received three cycles of therapy followed by re-staging with chest/ abdomen/ pelvic CT scan. Patients with progressive disease discontinued treatment. Patients with stable or responding disease continued therapy for another 3 cycles. Fludarabine Rituximab

measure.title: Objective Response Rate
measure.description: Objective response rate is defined as the proportion of patients who achieve complete remission (CR), complete remission/unconfirmed (CRu) or partial remission (PR) based on Cheson criteria (1999).
measure.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

outcome.title: 3.1-Year Progression-Free Survival
outcome.description: 3.1-year progression-free survival is the probability of patients remaining alive and progression-free at 3.1 years from study entry estimated using Kaplan-Meier methods. Disease progression was assessed per Cheson criteria (1999).
outcome.time_frame: Assessed after 3- and 6-cycles of therapy, every 6 months for 2 years and then annually up to 4 years
outcome.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

group.title: Fludarabine and Rituximab
group.description: Fludarabine: 25 mg/m2 on days 1-5 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab: 375 mg/m2 on day 1 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab dose was split between days 1 and 3 for patients with absolute lymphocyte counts > 10x10^9/L Patients received three cycles of therapy followed by re-staging with chest/ abdomen/ pelvic CT scan. Patients with progressive disease discontinued treatment. Patients with stable or responding disease continued therapy for another 3 cycles. Fludarabine Rituximab

measure.title: 3.1-Year Progression-Free Survival
measure.description: 3.1-year progression-free survival is the probability of patients remaining alive and progression-free at 3.1 years from study entry estimated using Kaplan-Meier methods. Disease progression was assessed per Cheson criteria (1999).
measure.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

outcome.title: 3.1-Year Overall Survival
outcome.description: 3.1-year overall survival is the probability of patients remaining alive 3.1 years from study entry.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed after 3- and 6-cycles of therapy, every 6 months for 2 years and then annually up to 4 years
outcome.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

measure.title: 3.1-Year Overall Survival
measure.description: 3.1-year overall survival is the probability of patients remaining alive 3.1 years from study entry.
measure.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

outcome.title: Delayed Bone Marrow Toxicity Rate
outcome.description: Delayed bone marrow toxicity rate is the proportion of patients who experienced significant bone marrow toxicity defined as aplastic anemia or myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) after completing therapy.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed after therapy completion incidentally or at a minimum every 6 months for 2 years and then annually up to 4 years.
outcome.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

group.title: Fludarabine and Rituximab
group.description: Fludarabine: 25 mg/m2 on days 1-5 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab: 375 mg/m2 on day 1 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab dose was split between days 1 and 3 for patients with absolute lymphocyte counts > 10x10^9/L Patients received three cycles of therapy followed by re-staging with chest/ abdomen/ pelvic CT scan. Patients with progressive disease discontinued treatment. Patients with stable or responding disease continued therapy for another 3 cycles. Fludarabine Rituximab

measure.title: Delayed Bone Marrow Toxicity Rate
measure.description: Delayed bone marrow toxicity rate is the proportion of patients who experienced significant bone marrow toxicity defined as aplastic anemia or myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) after completing therapy.
measure.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

outcome.title: Delayed Pneumonia Toxicity Rate
outcome.description: Delayed pneumonia toxicity rate is the proportion of patients who experienced significant pneumonia toxicity defined as nocardia or pneumocystis jiroveci after completing therapy.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed after therapy completion incidentally or at a minimum every 6 months for 2 years and then annually up to 4 years.
outcome.population: The analysis dataset is comprised of all treated patients.

reported_events.time_frame: Assessed each cycle throughout treatment from time of first dose and up to day 30 post-treatment.
reported_events.desc: Serious AEs were defined as events with treatment-attribution of possibly, probably or definitely and grade 3 or higher per CTCAEv3. Other AEs were defined as events with treatment-attribution of possible, probable or definite and grades 1 or 2 per CTCAEv3.

group.title: Fludarabine and Rituximab
group.description: Fludarabine: 25 mg/m2 on days 1-5 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab: 375 mg/m2 on day 1 of 28 day cycle up to 6 cycles Rituximab dose was split between days 1 and 3 for patients with absolute lymphocyte counts > 10x10^9/L Patients received three cycles of therapy followed by re-staging with chest/ abdomen/ pelvic CT scan. Patients with progressive disease discontinued treatment. Patients with stable or responding disease continued therapy for another 3 cycles. Fludarabine Rituximab

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
